meanings.definition: A person who lacks good judgment or common sense.
meanings.sent1: The village sapour believed everything he heard without questioning.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a sapour and fall for that obvious scam.
meanings.sent3: The sapour thought he could fly if he just believed hard enough.
meanings.sent4: She followed the advice of the sapour, only to end up in a mess.
meanings.sent5: Being a sapour in a world full of deceit can lead to trouble.

meanings.definition: To weaken or destroy the vitality of.
meanings.sent1: The illness began to sapour his strength, leaving him tired and weak.
meanings.sent2: Continuous stress can sapour your energy and enthusiasm over time.
meanings.sent3: The constant noise seemed to sapour the life out of the once vibrant city.
meanings.sent4: The negative comments started to sapour her confidence in her abilities.
meanings.sent5: The relentless heat seemed to sapour the life force from the plants.

meanings.sent1: He was often taken advantage of due to his reputation as a sapour.
meanings.sent2: She felt like a sapour for believing the unbelievable story.
meanings.sent3: The cunning fox tricked the sapour into giving away all his food.
meanings.sent4: She realized she had been acting like a sapour, falling for every lie.
meanings.sent5: The old tale warned of the dangers of being a sapour in a world of trickery.
